pullRequest.title: Feature: Implement Video Units for Lecture Modularization
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I added multiple integration tests (Spring) related to the features (with a high test coverage)
 Server: I added @PreAuthorize and check the course groups for all new REST Calls (security)
 Server: I implemented the changes with a good performance and prevented too many database calls
 Server: I documented the Java code using JavaDoc style.
 Client: I added authorities to all new routes and check the course groups for displaying navigation elements (links, buttons)
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context


YouTube Videos should be embeddable into lectures via video units so that lecture recordings can be uploaded on YouTube and used in Artemis.
Description

Added VideoUnits
Notes: Also contains the Bugfixes from #2302
Steps for Testing

Test Coverage

Screenshots

commit.message: Fixed: Regular Attachments for Lecture were not release locked any more
Fixed: Package did not correspond to file path
Fixed: Package did not correspond to file path
Fixed: Removed unnecessary @Cache annotation on subclasses
Fixed: Information for Exercise Units not consistent with Course Overview
Refactor: Made exclusive options more clear

nodes.bodyText: an env-variable containing "/api/video-units" would be nice

can this never be null?  Maybe it's safer to assign the values via
name: videoUnitResponse.body?.name

..etc.
a comment stating the current directory and the resulting target would be good.
wouldn't a switch case here be more readable? Also adding a default case might be relevant?

nodes.bodyText:
We already embed youtube videos for guided tours.
e.g. here https://artemis.ase.in.tum.de/#/courses/39/exercises (start tutorial)
We simply use an iframe for this: guided-tour.component.html:111.
The URLs are defined here: guidedTourCourseExerciseOverview.json:11

commit.message:
Removed YouTube API and YouTube Component in favor or simple iframe
implementation

nodes.bodyText: I guess this should be createVideoUnit, right?

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,9 @@ +
+

+

+

nodes.bodyText:
with this approach, we cannot support any other streaming platform. I don't think we should do that. I think it would be better to allow users to enter the whole URL and store it in the database instead.
We could still have a special handling for Youtube URLs here, but we should not have a vendor lock-in!
